messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Re: Trials the Samurai Endured -- Will Adams
messages.msgSnippet: I m reading a interesting book by Giles Milton. It is about the first ships arived in japan in 1600. In particular it tells the story of William Adams. I
messages.messageBody:
I'm reading a interesting book by Giles Milton. It is about the first ships arived in japan in 1600. In particular it tells the story of William Adams.
I haven't finished it yet, but I can tell you something about his wives.
The one who remained in England survived with the provents that the Company of the Calls Oriental (compagnia delle Indie Orientali in italian...I don't know if this is the right traslation!) but I still don't know what happens to her next.
Then, Adams had another wife...a japanese one, who lived in his estate in Hemi.
As soon as I finish the book I'll tell you more!
SALUT!
Daniele

Eponymous13@... wrote:
Hey.
Just a question. Is anything more known about what happened to
Adams's widow after he died? I.e. did she remarry or is this not known? Just
wondering. :-)

L8r
Tim
